clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes of Geriatric Hip Fractures in Assiut University Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Outcomes of Geriatric Hip Fractures in Assiut University Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: hip fractures are common problem specially in elderly population the incidence is increasing nowadays because of increased incidence of motor vehicle accidents

detailed_description.textblock: hip fractures are a common problem specially in elderly population the incidence is increasing nowadays because of increased incidence of motor vehicle accidents the incidence of morbidity and mortality is increasing today and the mortality rate is about 30% the aim of the study is follow up of the patients aged 65 years and older who experienced hip fractures for one year to evaluate the outcome of different ways of intervention in elderly population.

primary_outcome.measure: determine the outcome of geriatric hip fractures
primary_outcome.description: determine the morbidity and mortality of surgery of hip fractures in elderly patients aged 65 years and older

secondary_outcome.measure: determine magnitude of geriatric hip fractures
secondary_outcome.description: determine incidence of hip fractures which is increasing nowadays

other_outcome.measure: determine the readmission rate to the hospital and why they were readmitted
other_outcome.description: determine the readmission rate to the hospital and why they were readmitted to the hospital due to metal failure , infection ...etc

other_outcome.measure: determine the risk factors for morbidity and mortality
other_outcome.description: determine what are the factors and causes that increase the risk of morbidity and mortality in the patients

arm_group.description: outcome of open reduction and internal fixation of fractures of proximal femur and acetabulum in patients aged 65 years and older
outcome of arthroplasty of fractures of proximal femur and acetabulum in patients aged 65 years and older
outcome of conservative management of fractures of proximal femur and acetabulum in patients aged 65 years and older

intervention.intervention_name: Arthroplasty or open reduction and internal fixation
intervention.description: fixation of proximal femoral fractures or replacement with prosthesis

study_pop.textblock: patients aged 65 years old and older with fracture acetabulum , neck of femur , trochanteric , subtrochanteric and reverse trochanteric fractures admitted inside assuit university hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients aged 65 years and older
- with fractures acetabulum , neck of femur , trochanteric , subtrochanteric and reverse trochanteric fractures
Exclusion Criteria:
- no patient will be excluded
